intro: Siphocampylus fuscus, commonly known as the dark siphocampylus, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to spread vegetatively, forming dense colonies. Due to its preference for specific habitats, it is often found in regions with cool, temperate climates.
